args:
Reunited at the Halidom, the siblings craft a
plan to defeat the enemy. When the fight begins,
things proceed smoothly until a lone figure
appears on the front lines and reverses the
tide—a man calling himself Alberius.
Everyone but {player_name} and\nZethia, though that's hardly a surprise.
Those two are up in Gatov's old stomping\ngrounds. The deserts of North Grastaea's\neastern edge.
I sent the Gran Fiore there, but it will be\nawhile yet before it arrives.
That ship and the Halidom are linked by\nAlberius's legacy. That device will be able\nto transport them here directly.
Hmph. I'm not relying on people who may\nnever actually turn up. On to the matter at\nhand.
A few days ago, all of Alberia's great cities\ncame under attack from fiends frenzied by\nblack mana simultaneously.
Until then, the they'd operated on instinct,\nwithout strategy or coordination. This was\nsomething altogether different.
You saw clear intention in their attack...\nAny ideas as to what they were after?
Their target is the Alberian royal line.\n...Us.
W-wait, US?! Why?! What did WE ever do?
Each of the sites struck bears some deep\nconnection to the Alberian crown. This\nwasn't just random violence.
It was a clear declaration of war.
B-but why come after US? What possible\nreason could—
More than you could count. The far more\nimportant question now is how to deal with\nthis encroaching threat.
I assume that at the point you've asked us\nhere, you already have something in mind,\nLeonidas?
Obviously. I've prepared a warm reception\nfor the enemy, but that requires them to\nshow up.
Bringing you all here was the simplest\nmeans to ensure that they target the\nHalidom.
True, it's much simpler to come up with a\njoint response here than if we spread out\nand didn't know who'd be targeted when.
Agreed. Forcing a fight at a well-fortified\nlocation is basic strategy. But depending\non their speed, we could be surrounded—
The enemy's numbers are comparatively\nfew. You saw that in the force that waylaid\nyou. So before they can encircle our—
...Urk. I can't follow the conversation at all.
That's not a sentiment you voice aloud,\nEmile.
Oh, please. It's fine. I don't understand\nwhat I don't understand. My policy is to\nleave these matters to those who do!
Rather an irresponsible policy, isn't it?\n...Though I suppose in this case I can't\nsay I disagree.
None of us can do everything alone. If our\nexpertise differs, we ought to delegate\neach matter to the appropriate expert.
Agreed. A wise king must know when to\ndefer to others, though it takes courage to\nadmit it.
To rely on others is to admit we lack the\nability ourselves, after all. An especially\ndifficult task for us so-called ＂gifted＂ ones.
Indeed... Ironically, Emile may be the best\nsuited to rule among all of us.
Wait, you two are...praising me?! Heh ha\nha ha haaa! It seems my time has finally\ncome! The Emile Era starts today!
Quiet down, fool. No one is saying a king\nhas license for ignorance and sloth.
Very true. We all have King Alberius as a\nmodel to. Though we may fall short, we\nought at least aspire to share his ideals.
Grk... But Alberius always makes for such\nan unflattering comparison.
Even father once warned me not to choose\nAlberius as my lodestar.
An over-strong king will know only\nisolation... And a king must never stand\nalone, he said.
That advice may have been for his own\nbenefit as much as yours. Father was ever\nthe type to take on everything himself.
But the world needed a hero of Alberius's\nstature at the time. I suspect it may need\none now, as well.
Were he alive today, I would dearly like to\nsee how King Alberius would forge order\nfrom these chaotic times.
I could not disagree more. Hypotheticals\nare meaningless. The reins of this era are\nnot in some dead hero's hands, but in ours.
How to rule our lands, how to face our\nfoes... It falls on us to decide these things,\nand none other.
I'll require you to serve some purpose as\nwell, Emile. If you would claim to hold any\nqualities of leadership, show them now.
I-I know. It may have been a stroke of luck\nthat landed me on the throne, but even I\nhave plans to fill the role adequately.
Whatever I must do, I shall see it done!
The Next Day\nA plain near the Halidom, covered in dense fog
What are you doing? Were has that brief\nglimpse of courage from yesterday gone?
The enemy are still coming. If your words\nthen weren't a total lie, now is the time to\nprove it!
Fine. Fine! I'll prove it... It's no secret that\nI lack your martial talent, brother, but I...\nI've got...!
I've got a horde of minions! I'll crush\nfiends and dragons alike under the sheer\nweight of numbers!
Onward, my warriors of the Dyrenell Army!\nAll units, forward march!
It looks as if even Emile is putting in an\neffort this time.
Yes. We can't go letting him show us up.
Indeed. I will muster every ounce of might\nI possess to lay ruin to the foes before me!\nNroooaaaaaargh!
This is the power of the dragonblood... To\nhave the members of the royal line all\ngathered in one place is incredible!
Heh ha ha ha ha! Well? Are you ready to\nsurrender before the awesome might of\nEmperor Emile?!
What's the problem, people?! What is\nhappening?!
...It seems a separate force has been\nadvancing through the fog in secret.
This area sees large temperature swings\nfrom day to night this time of year, which\ngives rise to dense fog. They used that...
Rgh... This isn't good. Their pincer attack is\nsapping our numbers. We're losing the\nadvantage.
Rrgh, so what if they have us sandwiched?!\nWe were absolutely mopping the floor with\nthem a moment ago!
Don't go all chicken on me now, not over\nthis! Get in there and FIGHT! Attack and\nattack and attack till they're all dead!
Oh, dear. It seems this one has mistaken\nrecklessness for valor.
Excuse me? Who is this guy? Hah, imagine\nstepping out on the front lines alone.
Go, you lot! All units, attack! Wipe the\nsmug look off that fool's face!
Soldiers of the Dyrenell Empire, eh?\n...Then I see no cause to hold back.
Hmph, how amusing. I shall lay bare\nwhatever threadbare parlor trick he's\nusing.
I'll see your bones reduced to ash! Full\nalchemical burst!
...Hah. An over-grand end for a charlatan.
Not a bad technique... But your judgment\nis questionable.
Impossible! He shapeshifted into a second\ndra—GRAAAUGH?!
Not just a shapeshifter, but the master of\nmultiple pactbound dragons, like\n{player_name}... Who are you?
